title.narrative: Train the Trainers in effective Peacebuilding and Conflict Management in Turbulent Contexts of Yemen

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 29777, 2502 LT The Hague, The Netherlands

title.narrative: Project photo
Narrative report

description.narrative: Reporting is an important management tool which is used to inform relevant government officials and other stakeholders about the results being achieved by individual projects and the programme as a whole. For project partners, it is compulsory to use the prescribed Orange Knowledge annual report format in order to report on project achievements. The annual report also provides valuable data on the financial situation of the project. Based on an analysis of the project performance in relation to the project output(s) and expected outcome(s), a revision of the project work plan may be suggested by the project partners. The consequences of a possible revision on the project work plan and budget must be made clear in the annual report. Nuffic monitors outputs and outcomes and not activities . Therefore, the main focus of the annual report must be on the achievement of the project’s output(s) and planned outcome(s). The information provided in the annual reports of the projects is used by Nuffic to monitor the progress of the project and to inform the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other stakeholders about the output(s) and outcome(s) being achieved by individual projects and the Orange Knowledge programme as a whole. Please note that if project progress is in accordance with the original planning, reporting requirements are minimal. Only in case of deviations from the planning, more elaboration is demanded. In the grant award letter, the dates for submission of the annual reports are mentioned. In case of a three-year project, between 5-7 reports are obligatory. The first report (0) is a very short report which focuses on specific conditions and/or recommendations in the grant. There is no need to report on progress in achieving outputs and outcomes, which is done in the first annual report. As annex to the report 0, the consortium agreements between the partners should be submitted. The final report must reflect on the entire project period.

title.narrative: 14. Final report TMT+/TMT

description.narrative:
Final conclusions TMT+/TMT (in case of final report) Reflect on how the training has contributed to addressing the capacity needs as described by the requesting organisation in the proposal form. How effective and efficient has the TMT+ been in reaching the desired objectives? Please formulate lessons learned and recommendations for the post-project period.
+
In your email submitting the final report, the partners will enclose: - an inventory of equipment purchased - a document signed by the (Lead partner) Dutch consortium/provider and Lead partner consortium country A or requesting organisation on the transfer of ownership - a list with the names and email addresses of staff members who participated in staff training for their registration in the Holland Alumni Network database

title.narrative: 2. Project progress and achievement

description.narrative: In this section (maximum 1000 words), please provide a global overview of the project progress **per output**. To what extent have they been achieved? Comment on the activities that have taken place and the most important milestones.

title.narrative: Narrative report

description.narrative: Reporting is an important management tool which is used to inform relevant government officials and other stakeholders about the results being achieved by individual projects and the programme as a whole. For project partners, it is compulsory to use the prescribed Orange Knowledge annual report format in order to report on project achievements. title.narrative: 14. Final report TMT+/TMT

description.narrative: Final conclusions TMT+/TMT (in case of final report) Reflect on how the training has contributed to addressing the capacity needs as described by the requesting organisation in the proposal form. How effective and efficient has the TMT+ been in reaching the desired objectives? Please formulate lessons learned and recommendations for the post-project period. + In your email submitting the final report, the partners will enclose: - an inventory of equipment purchased - a document signed by the (Lead partner) Dutch consortium/provider and Lead partner consortium country A or requesting organisation on the transfer of ownership - a list with the names and email addresses of staff members who participated in staff training for their registration in the Holland Alumni Network database

actual.value:
Given the degree of stated & additional outputs achieved (95%) on the one hand, and the feedback from the requesting organisation on the impact of the project to their organisational activities/ objectives, we can conclude that is TMT project was highly beneficial to Gusoor. In fact the organisation was very satisfied and mentioned that it was one of the kind capacity building trajectory they have received since the organisation was established. We have fully achieved the project objectives and additional project results which were not defined in the proposal (training on project management and financial sustainability). Therefore, we can conclude that the project was very successful and our collaboration will continue in the future.
As for the lessons learned, we have faced significant challenges in planning and execution of the project due to COVID-19 and deteriorating security situation in Yemen. In this regard, we have learned to act more adequately and consult earlier with the requesting organisation to discuss and agree on less ambitious alternatives. We are very thankful to Nuffic for having received extra time to implement the project. Without extra time and involvement of local expertise, it wouldn't be possible to implement this project properly.
​

title.narrative: 2. Project progress and achievement

description.narrative: In this section (maximum 1000 words), please provide a global overview of the project progress **per output**. To what extent have they been achieved? Comment on the activities that have taken place and the most important milestones.

actual.value:
**Output 1:** understanding peace building concepts, mechanisms, theory and practice **Output 2: **understanding in both theoretical and operational aspects of conflict prevention and peace building **Output 3:** skills in developing and implementing monitoring and evaluation plans for peace building programmes and projects **Output 4:** knowledge and skills on analysing and developing public policy papers **Output 5:** knowledge and skills on lobbying, networking and communication methods and tools
To achieve output 1-5 we have organised training on peace building and conflict resolution. The workshop was implemented for 5 training days with an average of 8 training hours per day from 14-17 February 2021, with the aim of strengthening the team's capabilities on conflict management and resolution, peace building and local mechanisms of intervention, in addition to strengthening the strategy of mobilisation, advocacy and social justice. The important milestone achieved was the fact that the alumni have developed interventions on local governance and community level to raise awareness and empower community members to promote peace building and resolve/ prevent conflicts. ++Based on the post-test evaluation we can state with confident that these outputs have been achieved with 95%.++ Please see appendix 1 (training report).
++**Additional outputs**++
**Output 6: **improved knowledge and skills in Strategic Planning The needs assessment has revealed that Gusoor was in dire need to develop and implement a sustainable strategic plan to work more efficiently and effectively to achieve it's long- and short- term goals. Therefore, a 5 days training and on-job coaching was organised to enable the alumni develop and implement a 3 years strategic plan. Based on the midterm evaluation we can conclude that this output has been achieved fully. Please see appendix for more details (training report).
**Output 7: **Improved knowledge and skills in Project Management for the Development Sector As a project based NGO, Gusoor was facing great challenges to manage their projects in the context of a conflict setting. Therefore, a 5 days training on Project Management for the Development Sector was organised in Caïro, Egypt. The post-test evaluations shows that this was a very much needed training and has enabled the alumni to work more effectively on the projects at Gusoor. It has enabled them to apply new approaches, methods, innovative tools and to work more efficiently as a team. A side effect, this training has also revealed many internal issues on managerial level/ organisational structure at Gusoor. We can state with full confident that this was a very useful training to Gusoor staff and we have achieved this output with 100%
**Output 8:** Improved knowledge and skills in Financial Sustainability Based on the needs assessment output we have developed and implemented a 5 days local training on financial sustainability to enable Gusoor sustain it's financial situation more carefully. The post-evaluations shows that this was also a very useful training for the alumni. We can conclude that this output has been achieved with 95%. Please see appendix for more details (training report).
​
​

title.narrative: B. Enhanced knowledge and skills of individuals and organisations (in partner countries and in the NL) in line with country/regional specific labour market needs & aiming at inclusiveness
B.O.1. Number of organisations strengthened by individual and/or group training

comment.narrative: 22-02-2022: Besides the requesting organisation, Gusoor staff members from another national NGO with whom Gusoor has strategic collaboration, has benefited indirectly from this TMT.

title.narrative: B.O.2. % of alumni / TMT participants who have applied the acquired knowledge and skills within their working environment

comment.narrative: 22-02-2022: The post-evaluation shows us that almost 95% of the trained staff have expressed that they have applied the gained knowledge and skills from the training. In fact, to ensure that the gained knowledge is internalised, we have assigned the the trained staff with back-to-homework.

title.narrative: B.I.1. Number of scholarship holders / TMT participants that have successfully completed course/training (male / female / minorities)
B.I.4. % of scholarships awarded to women
B.I.8. % alumni / TMT participants who state that they have acquired new knowledge and skills; e.g. problem solving, effective communication
B.I.11. Improved gender equality and gender awareness in the workplace

actual.value: Although the staff pool of the organisation is well gender-balanced and new manager is a strong women leader, it was clearly visible that the male board members are dominant in their appearance. This issue has been openly discussed during the training project management and improvements were already visible during the last days of the 5 days training. As follow-up, clear action points have been defined to stimulatie and promote women leadership more within the organisation beyond.

title.narrative: B.I.10. Changes in personal, academic and professional attitudes and attributes through training and education programmes

actual.value: The alumni have become more strategic and enterprising to sustain the future existence of their organisation (Gusoor). They are enabled to develop and implement a strategic plan for the coming 3 years to contribute to Gusoor's objectives. Furthermore, they have become aware of the necessity to collaborate more effectively as a team and to facilitate the personal growth process of each employee. For their own benefit and the organisation. The alumni has changed their attitude of not listinning to each other carefully, which has led to an organisational culture of systematic unproductive discussions, to a more effective communicators to have constructive brainstorm sessions instead.
